summary: This video presentation explores the concept of Explainable AI in the context of pneumonia detection from X-ray images, highlighting the challenges and potential solutions.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a red cap and a maroon shirt is giving a presentation in a room filled with shelves of medical supplies. He stands in front of a large screen displaying a slide titled "EXPLAINABLE AI FOR DETECTION OF PNEUMONIA FROM X-RAY IMAGES," which features a diagram of an X-ray image and a bar chart. The presenter gestures with his hands as he speaks, engaging with the audience. The slide then transitions to a new one titled "IMPLEMENTATION BARRIERS," accompanied by a graphic of three hexagons. The presenter continues to speak, pointing to the slide and emphasizing the points being discussed. The room is well-lit, and the audience is seated in front of the presenter, attentively watching the presentation. The atmosphere is professional and focused on the topic of AI in medical imaging.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip features a male speaker introducing himself and stating his intention to give a short presentation. He mentions the project was inspired by things Henning talked about and focuses on fixing implementation problems with CNN models in the healthcare sector, particularly in predicting pneumonia from X-ray images. He highlights problems with using this approach, including the "black box problem" and legal barriers. The speaker's tone is informational and engaging. The clip concludes with the speaker interjecting with "God."

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a red shirt and a red cap is giving a presentation in a room filled with shelves of medical supplies. He stands in front of a large screen displaying the title "OUR IDEA" with two bullet points: "Visualizing the AI's own 'methodology'" and "Visualizing it in a Radiology-based framework." The presenter uses hand gestures to emphasize his points, occasionally pointing to the screen to highlight specific ideas. The audience, partially visible in the foreground, appears engaged, with some members wearing masks. The room is well-lit, and the AV equipment is visible on a shelf to the right of the presenter. The atmosphere is professional and focused on the topic of AI visualization in radiology.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio begins with a male speaker introducing an idea that moves beyond simply visualizing what a CNN model is doing. He describes a desire to make it possible for a doctor or radiologist to discuss "with the AI on the individual level." The speaker describes a back and forth where the medical professional can ask questions and voice their own assessments, aiming to build a better working relationship with the AI. The goal is for this interaction to occur in the same framework familiar to the doctor, without requiring computer science expertise. The speaker concludes by summarizing the intent of this approach. The speaker sounds enthusiastic and articulate, with a confident tone.

events_list.video_caption: In a professional setting, a man wearing a maroon shirt and a red cap stands in front of a projector screen, presenting to an audience. The screen displays slides with medical images and text, including phrases like "OUR IDEA," "Visualizing the AI's own methodology," and "Visualizing It In a Radiology-based framework." The presenter uses hand gestures to emphasize points, pointing at the screen and moving around the room. The background features shelves filled with labeled boxes, and a sign reading "AV equipment" is visible. The audience, partially visible, appears engaged. The presentation includes detailed medical images, such as chest X-rays, with annotations and heat maps, and the presenter explains the significance of these visuals, pointing to specific areas on the slides. The atmosphere is educational and focused, with the presenter actively engaging with the audience through his gestures and explanations.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker discussing a prototype and what it can generate from an image, mentioning they will go into detail later. He then refers to two pictures and explains that they come from giving a model an X-ray image. He mentions it's their own trained model, based on CNN architecture. The model predicts pneumonia with 99% probability.

events_list.video_caption: In a medical setting, a man wearing a maroon shirt and a red cap stands in front of a screen displaying two chest X-rays labeled "CNN OG GRAD-CAM." He gestures towards the images, explaining their significance to an audience seated in front of him. The room is filled with shelves of medical supplies, and a sign reading "AV equipment" is visible in the background. The presenter uses hand movements to emphasize points, occasionally pointing at the X-rays and making explanatory gestures. The audience, including a person with gray hair, listens attentively. The scene transitions to a slide titled "AZGC: 'AUTOMATIC ZONE DIVISION OF GRAD-CAMS,'" featuring a bar graph and an X-ray image divided into zones, indicating a shift in the presentation's focus to a new topic. The presenter continues to engage with the audience, maintaining a professional and informative atmosphere throughout the presentation.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a male speaker discussing the use of something called a "gradcam," defining it as a tool used when talking about the convolutional neural network, asking the AI which parts of a picture or features were most important for a decision, which results in a "red blob." He explains that this is difficult to interpret, essentially saying that it highlights certain pixels as more important, without explaining what that means. He continues discussing a process called "Automatic Zone Division of Grad Cams". The speaker has a calm and instructional tone.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a maroon shirt and red cap presenting a slide titled "AZGC: 'AUTOMATIC ZONE DIVISION OF GRAD-CAMS'" in a classroom setting. The slide displays a bar graph with various zones and a corresponding X-ray image. The presenter uses hand gestures to emphasize points while explaining the content. The classroom is equipped with shelves filled with labeled boxes, a laptop, and a water bottle on a table. The audience, consisting of individuals with gray hair, is seated and attentively watching the presentation. The presenter points to different parts of the slide, indicating specific zones and their corresponding values, and uses a remote control to navigate through the presentation. The video captures the presenter's dynamic engagement with the audience, highlighting the educational atmosphere of the classroom.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip features a male speaker with a clear and enthusiastic tone, explaining a process involving "Grad-CAM" and dividing an area into "zones" colored based on red pixels. He uses the example of a radiologist looking at an X-ray, then relays how AI might analyze the same area. The speaker concludes with the radiologist then comparing these analyses and agreeing or disagreeing on a case-by-case basis. The overall goal is the possible collaboration between a human and artificial intelligence.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a maroon shirt and a red beanie is presenting in a room filled with shelves of medical supplies. He stands in front of a large projection screen displaying a slide titled "AIZGC: 'AUTOMATIC ZONE DIVISION OF GRAD-CAMS'" with a bar graph and an X-ray image of a chest. The presenter gestures towards the screen, pointing at different parts of the graph and the X-ray, explaining the content to an audience seated in front of him. The room is well-lit, and the atmosphere appears to be that of a professional or educational setting. The presenter's facial expressions and body language suggest he is actively engaged in conveying information. The slide's text and visuals are clearly visible, indicating a focus on medical imaging analysis. The audience, partially visible in the foreground, seems attentive to the presentation. The presenter's gestures and the slide's content suggest a detailed explanation of the Automatic Zone Division of Grad-CAMs, a technique likely used in medical imaging to highlight areas of interest in X-rays.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a single male speaker discussing how to automatically make a box plot, mentioning examples like "right long," "right long mid," "left long," and emphasizing that it provides the "exact number of things." He then pauses and continues speaking.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a maroon shirt and a red cap is giving a presentation in a room filled with shelves of medical supplies. He is standing in front of a large screen displaying a slide titled "AZGC: 'AUTOMATIC ZONE DIVISION OF GRAD-CAMS'" with a bar graph and an X-ray image of a chest. The man gestures towards the screen, pointing at different parts of the slide, and appears to be explaining the content to an audience seated in front of him. The room has a professional atmosphere, with a sign labeled "AV equipment" visible in the background, indicating the presence of audio-visual equipment. The man's facial expressions and body language suggest he is engaged in his presentation, emphasizing key points on the slide. The audience is partially visible, with the back of their heads and shoulders shown, indicating their attention towards the speaker. The video transitions to a close-up of the slide, showing detailed images of a normal chest X-ray, a Grad-CAM heatmap, and a segmented chest X-ray with zones labeled. The slide also includes a bar graph with different zones and their corresponding values, providing a visual representation of the data being discussed. The overall setting and content suggest an educational or professional environment focused on medical imaging and analysis.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip begins with a male speaker stating that the content is "all generated." He clarifies that any X-ray image can be input and the result will "pop out." He then provides further examples of other X-ray images being used. The tone is informative and somewhat technical.

events_list.video_caption: The video features a man in a maroon shirt and red cap presenting in front of a large screen displaying medical images and data. The screen shows three chest X-ray images labeled "Normal," "Grad-CAM Heatmap," and "Zones," along with a bar graph indicating "Right Lung Lower" as the highest value. The presenter gestures towards the screen, pointing at the images and the graph, while explaining the data. The background includes shelves filled with medical supplies and a sign reading "AV equipment." The audience, visible in the foreground, appears engaged, with some members having gray hair. The presenter uses hand gestures to emphasize points, occasionally raising his arms and pointing upwards. The setting suggests a professional environment, likely a medical or educational facility, where the presenter is discussing the significance of the displayed medical data.
events_list.audio_caption: A male speaker with an informative tone explains the functioning of CNNs, noting "if you're wondering how we make this" and mentioning "the first layer." He describes it as "the first eyes this computer has" and explains the convolutional layer, indicating it says "that's a cycle" before further details.

events_list.video_caption: In a classroom setting, a man wearing a maroon shirt and a red cap stands in front of a large screen displaying medical images and graphs. He gestures animatedly, pointing at the screen and explaining the content to an audience seated in front of him. The screen shows X-ray images of lungs, heatmaps, and bar graphs labeled with terms like "Normal," "Grad-CAM Heatmap," and "Zones," along with numerical data and percentages. The room is filled with shelves of medical supplies, and a sign reading "AV equipment" is visible in the background. The man appears to be giving a detailed presentation, using hand movements to emphasize key points. The audience, consisting of older individuals, listens attentively as the presenter continues to explain the medical data displayed on the screen.
events_list.audio_caption: A male speaker is describing the function of a convolutional layer for lung images, explaining how it outlines the lung and helps identify sections for analysis. He outlines the theory of the AI model being used to estimate the probability of pneumonia in X-rays and identify zones of importance. His tone is informative and enthusiastic.

events_list.video_caption: In a classroom setting, a man wearing a red cap and a maroon shirt stands in front of a projector screen displaying a Windows desktop with the title "BRUGERVENDELIG GUI" (User-Friendly GUI). He gestures towards the screen, which shows a file explorer window with various folders and files. The room is filled with shelves containing numerous labeled boxes, and a sign reading "AV equipment" is visible in the background. The man appears to be explaining the GUI, pointing at different elements on the screen. The camera then zooms in on the screen, showing a detailed view of the file explorer window and the desktop icons. The man continues to interact with the laptop on the table, demonstrating the GUI's features. The video transitions to a close-up of the desktop, highlighting the GUI interface with a dark background and orange accents. The interface includes a list of files and folders, a search bar, and a large black area, possibly for displaying content. The man's hand is seen pointing at the screen, emphasizing specific elements. The video concludes with a detailed view of the GUI interface, showing a bar chart and images of a human chest with highlighted areas, indicating a medical or diagnostic application. The interface is labeled with various sections, including "Prognosis," "Model prediction," and "Model accuracy," suggesting the GUI's functionality in medical analysis.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip begins with a man speaking about a "GUI" and program intended to be "friendly to use" and then confirms "yes". He continues, saying "So yeah, you can see" describing how to input an x-ray image and that it will "make that". Following the speech, there is a short sound effect that seems to indicate success or completion of a task.

events_list.video_caption: In the video, a man wearing a red cap and a maroon shirt is presenting a user-friendly GUI (Graphical User Interface) to an audience in a room filled with shelves of equipment. The presentation begins with a slide titled "BRUGERVENDELIG GUI" (User-Friendly GUI) displaying various medical images and data, including X-ray images of a human chest and a bar graph. The presenter gestures towards the screen, explaining the interface's features. The slide transitions to show different GUI elements, including a file explorer window and a blank interface, as the presenter continues to explain and point out specific features. The audience, consisting of individuals with gray hair, attentively watches the presentation. The presenter concludes with a slide that reads "THANK YOU FOR YOUR ATTENTION," signaling the end of the presentation. Throughout the video, the presenter maintains an engaging demeanor, using hand gestures to emphasize key points and interact with the audience.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip features a male speaker discussing their research project. He touches on how they made two models just for testing, and how one can technically "take any model you have, and use this framework with it." The speaker then states in theory it could work to make it "easier to build trust and have a better working relationship as a doctor with your AI." A different male voice asks about a cooperation with Ph.D. students. The primary speaker responds and there is background chatter.

events_list.video_caption: In a room filled with shelves of labeled storage boxes, a man wearing a maroon shirt and a red beanie stands in front of a projector screen, presenting a user-friendly graphical user interface (GUI) to an audience. The screen displays various slides, including a Windows desktop with icons, a file explorer window, and a GUI with X-ray images and a bar graph. The presenter gestures and speaks, explaining the features of the GUI, which is titled "BRUGERVENDELIG GUI" (User-Friendly GUI). The room is equipped with AV equipment, including a laptop and a microphone, and the atmosphere is educational and focused. The presenter's gestures and the changing slides on the screen indicate a dynamic and informative presentation.
events_list.audio_caption: The clip starts with a male speaker mentioning working with a PhD student named Danna, who gave them an image of the relationship between radiologists and the development of AI. According to the speaker, Danna pointed them to the idea that people are ready to trust these things but the legal limitations are the problem, so they thought of a solution. The male speaker sounds professional and informative.

events_list.video_caption: In a room filled with shelves of labeled boxes, a man wearing a red cap and a maroon shirt stands in front of a projector screen, presenting a user-friendly graphical user interface (GUI) titled "BRUGERVENDELIG GUI" (User-Friendly GUI). The screen displays various windows and interfaces, including a file explorer, a blank window, and a window with three chest X-ray images and a bar chart. The presenter gestures towards the screen, explaining the features and functionality of the GUI. The audience, partially visible in the foreground, appears engaged, with one person holding a laptop. The room is equipped with AV equipment, including a speaker and a laptop on a table, indicating a professional or educational setting. The presenter's body language and the changing content on the screen suggest a dynamic and informative presentation.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio features a single male speaker, who expresses gratitude towards someone, mentioning their helpful insights into the field, admitting his lack of knowledge in radiology before this, stating he's studying to be a data scientist. The speaker's tone is conversational. The audio ends abruptly.

events_list.video_caption: In a room filled with shelves of labeled boxes, a man wearing a maroon shirt and a red cap stands in front of a projector screen, presenting a user-friendly graphical user interface (GUI) titled "BRUGERVENDELIG GUI" (User-Friendly GUI). The screen initially displays a blank interface, but soon transitions to show three chest X-ray images and a bar graph, indicating the GUI's functionality in medical imaging analysis. The presenter, who appears engaged and occasionally gestures towards the screen, interacts with a laptop on a table to the right, which is equipped with a microphone and a water bottle. The audience, partially visible in the foreground, attentively watches the presentation. The room's atmosphere is professional and educational, with a focus on the presenter's explanation of the GUI's features and applications.
events_list.audio_caption: The audio clip starts with a male speaker offering to answer "any questions, if I have time." The speaker maintains a relatively neutral tone. This is followed by a sound that suggests a round of applause, presumably in response to the speaker.
